qas.question: What modern company has been notably working on a steam engine using modern materials?
How many cylinders does the Energiprojekt AB engine have?
How many pounds of steam per kilowatt hour does the Energiprojekt AB engine use?
What percentage of a high pressure engine's efficiency has the Energiprojekt AB engine achieved?
What modern company has been notably working on a combustion engine using modern materials?
How many cylinders does the compound engine have?
How many pounds of steam per kilowatt hour does the internal combustion engine use?
What percentage of a high pressure engine's efficiency has the compound engine achieved?

context: Although the reciprocating steam engine is no longer in widespread commercial use, various companies are exploring or exploiting the potential of the engine as an alternative to internal combustion engines. The company <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>Energiprojekt AB<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> in <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>Sweden<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> has made progress in using modern materials for harnessing the power of steam. The efficiency of Energiprojekt's steam engine reaches some <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>27-30<b9_0/><a4_0/>%<a4_2/><a4_1/> on high-pressure engines. It is a single-step, <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>5<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_0/>-cylinder<a2_1/> engine (no compound) with superheated steam and consumes approx. 4 kg (<a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>8.8<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> lb) of steam per kWh.[not in citation given]
